passages.text: Burlington Stores, Inc BURL | \(280.30
Outperform | Target Price/Base Case \(0.00 Company Update
Global Retailing, Softlines & Luxury Brands

1) SSS +5% well above Street +2%/EVRe +1% (market bogey was likely \~4%)  
2) GM 43.7% Beat Street 42.6%/EVRe 42.7%  
3) SG&A at 34.4% of sales Beat Street 34.9%/EVRe 34.6%  
4) EPS \(1.72 (ex-items)\) vs Street: \(1.28 / EVRe\) 1.33

Our Take: Reiterate Outperform, Expect P/E Expansion Across Offprice in the Near-Term: The SSS forensics are very good here. BURL's 2Q SSS accelerated the most vs Offprice peers on a 1-yr and 2-yr rate, with SSS accelerating +5pp on a 1-yr to +5% (Marmaxx accelerated +1pp, ROST +2pp). Separately, we think BURL accelerated the most intra-quarter with May at +1% and the quarter totaling to +5% (suggesting a very high exit rate in July). The +100bp GM beat was also impressive driven by Merch Margin +60bp (2-yr Merch Margin accelerated sequentially by +40bp despite the onset of tariffs) and SG&A leverage was better than expected, resulting in 6.0% EBIT margin for the quarter (Street 4.6%; EVRe 4.8%). Clean EPS of \(1.72 vs. our\) 1.33 was a huge beat.

2025 EPS Guidance Raised to \(9.19 to\) 9.59 (from \(8.70 to\) 9.30 prior): BURL was able to raise the high end of the FY guidance by +3%—though by less than the 2Q beat (likely adding \~\)0.13 of tariff cushion vs prior 2H guidance). Looking ahead to 3Q, in normal BURL practice, guidance is for SSS flat to +2% (conservatively assuming a deceleration from +5% in 2Q). Key on the call will be detail on the quarter-to-date call which is off to a solid start (before comparisons decelerate). As a reminder, BURL started 3Q24 with SSS up +6% in the first six weeks of the quarter before unfavorable weather (-3pp from warm weather, -1pp from hurricanes) dragged the remainder of the quarter down to -1%. Simply put, 2-year stack math suggests 3Q comps should beat guide materially with very easy compares ahead.

Inventory Loaded Up: Comp store inventory is down - 8%, - 13pp below comp sales growth and the widest gap in a long time. That said, packaway inventory increased to 50% of inventory (implying Packaway inventory dollars grew 41% YOY), in line with our checks that all three Offprices loaded up on inventory for the back half. We think that sets BURL up well to beat going forward.
Our \(\) 310\(target price is based on\) \sim 26x\$ our 2026E EPS.
Increased competition, economic slowdown, lack of inventory availability
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Time of dissemination: August 28 2025 8:10 AM ET

Evercore ISI's recommendations are based on a stock's total forecasted return over the next 12 months. Total forecasted return is equal to the expected percentage price return plus gross dividend yield. We divide our stocks under coverage into three primary ratings categories, with the following return guidelines:
Outperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be greater than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
In- Line- the total forecasted return is expected to be in line with the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.
Underperform- the total forecasted return is expected to be less than the expected total return of the analyst's coverage sector.

Coverage Suspended- the rating and target price have been removed pursuant to Evercore ISI policy when Evercore is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving this company and in certain other circumstances.

Rating Suspended- Evercore ISI has suspended the rating and target price for this stock because there is not sufficient fundamental basis for determining, or there are legal, regulatory or policy constraints around publishing, a rating or target price. The previous rating and target price, if any, are no longer in effect for this company and should not be relied upon.
Prior to October 10, 2015, the "Coverage Suspended" and "Rating Suspended" categories were included in the category "Suspended."

FINRA requires that members who use a ratings system with terms other than "Buy," "Hold/Neutral" and "Sell" to equate their own ratings to these categories. For this purpose, and in the Evercore ISI ratings distribution below, our Outperform, in Line, and Underperform ratings can be equated to Buy, Hold and Sell, respectively.
